sentences: See objekt kaalub 5 kilogrammi ja pikkusega meetri.
context: The word 'meetri' is the genitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'meeter', which means 'meter'. In English, it refers to either a unit of length (100 centimeters) or a measuring device. The genitive case in Estonian typically indicates possession or relationship, so 'meetri' can mean 'of meter', 'from meter', or be used as the object form when referring to measurement.
